title: Survey Reveals Consumers Prioritize Purchasing Sustainable Products and Desire Greater Transparency from ... - PR Newswire
summary: A recent Specright survey reveals that 80% of consumers trust companies that back up sustainability claims with shared data, yet 69% believe companies are not accurately reporting on their sustainability goals. Most consumers are willing to pay more for sustainable products and prefer companies that are transparent about their practices. Additionally, a significant portion of consumers is eager to recycle but seeks guidance from brands on the proper disposal methods. With heightened awareness around sustainability, it is expected this will influence purchasing decisions in 2024.

title: New York solar installation exemplifies Medline's commitment to sustainability in construction, operations - Medline Newsroom
summary: Medline has completed a 7.3 megawatt community solar installation on its Montgomery, New York distribution center, generating over 8.5 million kilowatt hours of clean power annually. title: Rothy's Fills Sustainability Role; Fashion's Biomass Move Causes Pollution, Deforestation: Short Takes - Yahoo Movies Canada
summary: Rothy's has appointed James Rogers as vice president of sustainability to enhance their circular economy initiatives and reduce environmental impacts in their supply chain. The company, known for creating footwear from recycled plastic bottles using a waste-minimizing 3D knitting process, has also launched a take-back program to recycle used shoes. However, a report by Stand Earth criticizes the fashion industry's switch to using biomass as a renewable energy source, which can increase deforestation and greenhouse gas emissions. The report suggests that the reliance on biomass poses serious threats to the environment, contradicting the sustainability claims made by several major fashion brands.

title: IBU Season 2023/2024 set for new rules and higher sustainability standards - International Biathlon Union
summary: The 2023/2024 IBU season will start with a focus on sustainability, as Organising Committees voluntarily signed the IBU's Sustainability Charter, committing to reducing environmental impacts while enhancing social legacies.
